intro: Sipanea pratensis, commonly known as the meadow sipanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Sipanea pratensis is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
